title: How to Make Southern Blackberry Delight

steps.headline: Set your oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit (175°C).
Melt the stick of butter into a casserole dish (about 2.5 quarts).
Open the frozen bag of berries.
steps.description: Pour about 3/4 cups of the sugar into the bag.

steps.headline: Combine the remainder of the sugar, flour, milk, and baking powder in with the butter.
Pour the whole bag of berries and sugar onto the mix in the casserole dish.
steps.description: Spread them evenly over the top of the mixture.

steps.headline: Bake in the preheated oven for about an hour and a half.
Using a toothpick is a good way to check if the cobbler is ready.
steps.description: Simply stick a toothpick a good ways down into the dish. If it comes out only showing berry juice it should be ready. However, if dough sticks to the toothpick let it cook a little longer.

text: Set your oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit (175°C).  Melt the stick of butter into a casserole dish (about 2.5 quarts).  Open the frozen bag of berries. Pour about 3/4 cups of the sugar into the bag. Combine the remainder of the sugar, flour, milk, and baking powder in with the butter.  Pour the whole bag of berries and sugar onto the mix in the casserole dish. Spread them evenly over the top of the mixture. Bake in the preheated oven for about an hour and a half.  Using a toothpick is a good way to check if the cobbler is ready. Simply stick a toothpick a good ways down into the dish. If it comes out only showing berry juice it should be ready. However, if dough sticks to the toothpick let it cook a little longer.
